recipe_ingredients: 8 ounces smoked andouille sausage, sliced into coins)
1/2 medium jalapeño pepper, seeds removed, minced
Fresh thyme or chopped fresh basil
1/3 cup brown sugar (granulated sugar will work fine, too)
6 cups oolong tea, brewed with 8 oolong tea bags or a similar amount of loose tea
2 rosemary sprigs, leaves bruised a bit to release their flavor
4 inch-thick boneless pork chops, preferably organic
3/4 cup fresh rosemary leaves (I think they're called leaves?)
1 cup red wine (I used a red blend)
several strips of tangerine peel (big enough to pick out later)
3/4 package of short tube like pasta
1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground nut meg
3 cups red leaf or Bibb lettuce, cleaned and dried and torn into large bite-sized pieces
1 cup shredded leftover roast chicken (make the chunks as delicate or as rustic as you like)
1 to 2 jalapeños, diced (seeded if sensitive to heat)
4 scallions, finely sliced, white and light green parts
1/4 to 1/2 cups extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for the corn
1 pinch Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
3 tablespoons pineapple juice (I keep small cans on hand for this dish)
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lime juice, from 1 lime
2 cups or one 15 ounce can cooked black beans, drained and rinsed
Corn or flour tortillas, for serving
1 ripe peach, peeled, pitted and sliced
as much fresh goat cheese as you like
small handful fresh thyme, basil and chives; washed and chives chopped
equal parts extra virgin olive oil and Granny Smith Apple Balsamic Vinegar (from Williams-Sonoma); use white Balsamic and/or champagne vinegar if you can't/don't want to get the apple vinegar
3 small (2 to 3 inch diameter) beets, any color, with the greens
1/2 package of frozen puff pastry, or equivalent of homemade
1/4 to 1/2 cups whole milk or cream
3 to 5 ounces soft chevre style goat cheese, room temperature
Salt, pepper, and nutmeg to taste
2 plums (any color works here; my favorites are the deep-red fleshed ones)
2 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves removed from sprig
3 tablespoons sea salt (divided, plus more for serving)
8 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (organic or natural, not Perdue or somesuch)
1 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper (plus more for serving)
1 rope (13 1/2 ounces) cheese sausage, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1/2 pound snap peas, strings removed and halved crosswise
flaky salt, such as Maldon or Jacobsen
2 cups hulled strawberries, cut in half
Maldon sea salt or other flaky sea salt
1 dried red chile, crushed into tiny bits
Maldon or other flaky sea salt
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 garlic cloves, lightly smashed (skins left on)
1/2 cup fino sherry or dry white wine
1 lemon, cut into thin slices (skin left on; seeds discarded)
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon or lime juice, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
3 tablespoons melted coconut oil or olive oil
1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon cumin seeds or ground cumin
1 cup (180 g) split red lentils or other (see notes above)
Cooked basmati rice, plain yogurt, chopped fresh cilantro, and naan for serving
1 pound dried chickpeas, see notes above if using canned
1 small onion, diced to yield about 1 cup
1/4 cup plus two tablespoons melted butter (plus more for the pan)
2-3 granny smith apples, peeled, cored and thinly sliced
12 to 15 green beans, trimmed and chopped
1 green chile, seeded and finely chopped
1 pound baby potatoes, cut into small cubes
6 potatoes, or 5 to 6 cups leftover mashed potatoes
2 cups leftover cooked greens such as cabbage, kale, or collards
2 fresh green chilies, such as serrano or jalapeño, minced
1 pound shallots, the larger ones halved
1 tablespoon thyme, finely chopped, plus a few whole sprigs
1 large cauliflower (washed & trimmed into bite size pieces)
3 small garlic cloves (peeled and finely chopped)
1 handful Fresh Italian flat leaf parsley
1/4 cup (or more if needed) unbleached baking flour
1/4 cup (or more if needed) whole milk
1 pinch Salt and pepper to taste
1 tablespoon lemon juice, or to taste
1 pound carrots, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
2 fat cloves garlic, peeled and smashed
1 1/2 pounds carrots, peeled and cut into 1/4 inch x 3 inch sticks
1 fennel bulb, ends trimmed, bulb cut in half, each half cored and cut lengthwise in 1/8”-inch slices
4 strips of orange zest,– each 1 inch x 4” inch (use vegetable peeler)
1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds, –crushed in a mortar
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fennel fronds or dill
1 pound skinny carrots, scraped and cut into little cubes
1 teaspoon each: cinnamon, nutmeg, cumin, paprika (or aleppo pepper, thanks for the introduction, Sagegreen!), and caraway seeds
1 14.5 ounce can chopped tomatoes, juice and all
2 pounds small carrots (3 to 4 inches, ½ inch thick), or large carrots quartered and cut into 3-inch segments, peeled (about 4 cups)
2 cups mixed baby sprouts, herbs, and microgreens
16 carrots with tops (you can tell how fresh the carrots are by the tops), not more than 3/4 inch in diameter, peeled and trimmed with 1 inch of top left on
1 or more grinds of white pepper
6 Bibb lettuce leaves, larger ones torn in half
1 teaspoon coriander seeds, lightly crushed with back of knife
1/2 teaspoon caraway seeds, lightly crushed with back of knife
1 pound slender carrots, trimmed and peeled
4 garlic cloves, peeled and lightly smashed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 cup finely chopped mustard greens (to prep for chopping, wash several times in cold water and remove stems and center ribs)
1 tablespoon finely grated lemon zest, from 1 large or 2 small lemons
1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil, plus more for the pan
2 cups (250g) all-purpose flour, plus more for the pan
1 2-inch (5-cm) piece of ginger, peeled and finely grated
2 large carrots (7 ounces/200g total), coarsely grated
2 tablespoons black sesame seeds, plus more as needed
4 tablespoons chopped preserved lemon (about one lemon)
2 tablespoons kosher salt, plus extra if needed
White ground pepper (or black pepper), to taste
2 tablespoons neutral oil, such as safflower or canola
2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
1/2 ounce of garlic (about 3 medium sized cloves), finely chopped
15 fresh sage leaves, divided (leave 10 sage leaves whole; cut the remaining 5 leaves into thin shreds)
250 grams dried pasta (I used Casarecci, a short pasta similar to penne), roughly half a package of pasta
1/4 cup melted coconut oil or olive oil
8 pieces bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs or drumsticks
1 pinch kosher salt and pepper to taste
1 or 2 dried blood orange wheels (see note)
a handful of slow roasted tomatoes (see note)
2 pounds lamb tenderloin or boneless shank or neck, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
1 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley, plus extra chopped for garnish
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
3 carrots, peeled and cut into chunks
2 sprigs rosemary, de-stemmed and finely chopped
2 sprigs thyme, de-stemmed and finely chopped
2 cups Chicken Broth (or replace with 2 tsp Vegetable Bouillon+ 2 cups water)
5 Yellow (or all one color) heirloom tomatoes, halved
3 Early girl tomatoes, an "X" cut into the bottom skin
2 cups Mixed mushrooms (king oyster and shiitake are nice), sliced
5 cups assorted dried beans, such as Anasazi, pinto, black, adzuki, pink and red, sorted and rinsed well, soaked in ample salted water for 3 or 4 hours or overnight
3 fresh bay leaves, twisted along their spines to crack them slightly
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon ground chili, or to taste
1/2 teaspoon chipotle chili powder, or to taste
1 teaspoon cumin seeds, lightly toasted and then pounded in a mortar and pestle
1 large can fire-roasted tomatoes. (I use Muir Glen).  Otherwise, you could use whole, diced, or petite-diced, according to your preference
1/2 naval orange, skin and pith removed, coarsely chopped

Rice as an accompaniment (see my brown-rice pilaf within my recipe for Sephardic Megedarra -- if you start it at the same time you saute the aromatics here, it will be done just about when the chili is done)
Guacamole (see my recipe for Plain and Simple Guacamole and maybe increase by 1 avocado + extra lime juice and garlic)
Sliced scallions or minced white onions
Refrigerated-type salsa (or homemade: chopped tomatoes, fresh jalapeno, seeded & minced, diced onion, minced garlic and a squeeze of lime)
1 head of garlic, peeled & separated into cloves
1/2 pound black eyed peas, quick soaked & drained
1/2 pound baby lima beans, quick soaked & drained (or dried fava or soy beans)
4 chipotles in adobo about 1/2 a 7 oz can
2 tablespoons Shaoxing rice wine - or dry sherry
1 tablespoon finely minced or grated ginger
3-4 small, red Thai bird chiles, seeds removed, finely chopped
1 bunch scallions, white and green parts, cut on the diagonal, 1/4 inch pieces
2 tablespoons kecap manis (sweet Indonesian Soy Sauce) You can substitute Hoisin Sauce
1/3 cup Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
Kecap Manis and Siracha sauce to taste
1 bunch Swiss chard, stems and ribs removed and leaves roughly torn into 2-inch pieces
1 can cannellini beans (16 or 19 ounces, or about 2 cups), drained and rinsed
Finely grated zest and 1 tablespoon juice from one lemon (reserving extra juice for finishing dish)
16 ounces (about 3 or 4 links) good-quality chicken or pork sausage, removed from casings and cut into 3/4-inch pieces (can also use pre-cooked sausage, sliced into small pieces)
Finely grated Parmesan or pecorino, to serve
5 pounds beef stewing meat, cut into 2-3 inch pieces
1 pinch salt, plus more to taste
1 pinch pepper, plus more to taste
1/3 cup mixed olive and canola oil
2 leeks, washed well and cut thinly
1 cup canned whole tomatoes with juices
2 pounds beef or veal; cheeks, chuck or foreshank
1/2 pound stewing beef, cut into 1 inch cubes
1 clove of garlic, cut in half
3 pounds beef chuck, cut in 2-inch chunks
1 large yellow onion, cut in chunks
1/2 pound white mushrooms, halved (quartered if large)
1 pound cubed lamb (leg or shoulder will work—mine was just labeled "all-natural lamb for stew")
1 teaspoon salt, plus more if needed
2 cups peeled sweet potato, cubed into about 1/2-inch pieces
Zest of 1/2 lemon, plus more if desired
Zest of 1/2 orange, plus more if desired
1 Medium onion, halved and halves cut into 1/4 inch wedges
1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into half-inch cubes (about 2 1/4 cups)
3 cups packed, roughly chopped kale (stems removed before chopping)
5-6 sweet potatoes, sliced very thinly using a mandoline
1 leek, white part only, rinsed thoroughly and diced
5 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1" cubes
2 1/2 cups whole wheat or whole wheat pastry flour
1/2 cup yogurt, buttermilk, or milk soured with one teaspoon white vinegar or lemon juice
2 medium-sized leeks, washed and thinly sliced
1 pound parsnips (number will vary depending upon size)
4 ounces feta, crumbled (a creamy French or Israeli style is nice)
3/4 cup canola oil for frying (amount will vary depending upon how many skillets you want to have going)
1 1/2 pounds seedless black grapes on the vine
4 thin center cut pork rib chops, about 1/2-inch thick (about 1 1/2 pounds total)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 bone-in pork chops, about 10 ounces each
2 to 4 hot and sweet peppers as desired
1 splash White wine or white vinegar, as needed
1 sweet apple (More like Gala, not red delicious)
1/2 teaspoon dried, crushed rosemary (that way you don't end up with twigs in your food)
Water or apple cider, as needed
1/2 pound lacinato kale (about one small bunch, or half of a larger bunch)
1/2 pound curly kale (about one small bunch, or half of a larger bunch)
1 pound green cabbage (about half a medium head or a quarter of a large one)
2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons red wine vinegar
1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, for assembly
1 pound kielbasa sausage, cut into pieces and halved longways
1/2 small bunch of kale, torn or chopped into 1-inch pieces
1/2 small loaf of crusty bread, cubed
1 bunch (large) lacinato kale, chopped very small, almost minced
2 teaspoons fresh ginger, peeled and minced
2 teaspoons each chopped basil, tarragon, chives and mint
1/2 pound brussels sprouts, stems trimmed and sprouts halved
1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more if needed
2 1/2 medium butternut squashes, cut in half and seeded
2 pinches salt and pepper, plus more to taste
2 inches fresh ginger, peeled and chopped
2 teaspoons garam masala (preferably) or curry powder
2 cups low sodium/no sodium vegetable broth
1 1/2 cups plain drinkable yogurt, kefir, or buttermilk
2 cups cornmeal, preferably Anson Mills Antebellum Coarse Yellow Cornmeal
